page_size – The number of comments to retrieve per page
flagged – Filter comments by flagged for abuse status.

desc_content.paragraph: Return the list of all discussion threads pertaining to the given course
Parameters:

request: The django request objects used for build_absolute_uri course_key: The key of the course to get discussion threads for page: The page number (1-indexed) to retrieve page_size: The number of threads to retrieve per page count_flagged: If true, fetch the count of flagged items in each thread topic_id_list: The list of topic_ids to get the discussion threads for text_search A text search query string to match following: If true, retrieve only threads the requester is following author: If provided, retrieve only threads by this author thread_type: filter for “discussion” or “question threads flagged: filter for only threads that are flagged view: filters for either “unread” or “unanswered” threads order_by: The key in which to sort the threads by. The only values are

definition_list_item.term: order_direction: The direction in which to sort the threads by. The default

definition.paragraph: and only value is “desc”. This will be removed in a future major version.

definition_list_item.term: requested_fields: Indicates which additional fields to return

desc_content.paragraph: Note that topic_id_list, text_search, and following are mutually exclusive.
Returns:
A paginated result containing a list of threads; see discussion.rest_api.views.ThreadViewSet for more detail.
Raises:

PermissionDenied: If count_flagged is set but the user isn’t privileged ValidationError: if an invalid value is passed for a field. ValueError: if more than one of the mutually exclusive parameters is
CourseNotFoundError: if the requesting user does not have access to the requested course PageNotFoundError: if page requested is beyond the last
Returns the URL for the thread_list_url field, given a list of topic_ids
Returns the list of comments made by the user in the requested course.

page_size – The number of comments to retrieve per page
requested_fields – Indicates which additional fields to return for
comment. (each child)

section.title: lms.djangoapps.discussion.rest_api.render module
section.paragraph: Note that this module is designed to imitate the front end behavior as implemented in Markdown.Sanitizer.js.

desc_content.paragraph: Render raw_body to HTML.
This includes the following steps:

list_item.paragraph: Convert Markdown to HTML
Sanitise HTML using nh3

desc_content.paragraph: Note that this does not prevent Markdown syntax inside a MathJax block from being processed, which the forums JavaScript code does.

This function takes a list of topic ids and a list of topics, and returns the list of archived topics.
A topic is considered archived if it has a non-null usage_key field.
Args: - filtered_topic_ids (List[str]): A list of topic ids to filter on. - topics (List[Dict[str, str]]): A list of topic dictionaries. - Each dictionary should have a ‘id’ and a ‘usage_key’ field.
Returns: - A list of archived topic dictionaries, with the same format as the input topics.

Returns: - A list of topic ids, extracted from the input list of topics.

bool

desc_content.paragraph: Removes all objects of type “sequential” from a nested list of objects if they have no children. After removing the empty sequentials, if the parent of the sequential is now empty, it will also be removed. Parameters: data (list): A list of nested objects to check and remove empty sequentials from.
Returns: list: The modified list with empty sequentials removed.
Iterates over the list of dicts and assigns the provided value to the given attribute

list_item.paragraph: threads – List of threads (dict objects)
attribute – the key for thread dict
value – the value to assign to the thread attribute

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: DeveloperErrorViewMixin, ViewSet

block_quote.paragraph: Retrieve the list of comments in a thread, retrieve the list of comments from an user in a course, retrieve the list of child comments for a response comment, create a comment, or modify or delete an existing comment.

desc_content.paragraph: Example Requests:
GET Comment List Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: thread_id (required when username is not provided): The thread to retrieve comments for
username (required when thread_id is not provided): The user from whom to retrieve comments
course_id (required when username is provided): The course from which to retrive the user’s comments

endorsed: If specified, only retrieve the endorsed or non-endorsed comments accordingly. Required for a question thread, must be absent for a discussion thread. This parameter has no effect when fetching comments by username.
flagged: Only retrieve comments that were flagged for abuse. This requires the requester to have elevated privileges, and has no effect otherwise.
page: The (1-indexed) page to retrieve (default is 1)
page_size: The number of items per page (default is 10, max is 100)
requested_fields: (list) Indicates which additional fields to return for each thread. (supports ‘profile_image’)

desc_content.paragraph: GET Child Comment List Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: comment_id (required): The comment to retrieve child comments for
page: The (1-indexed) page to retrieve (default is 1)
page_size: The number of items per page (default is 10, max is 100)
requested_fields: (list) Indicates which additional fields to return for each thread. (supports ‘profile_image’)

desc_content.paragraph: POST Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: thread_id (required): The thread to post the comment in
parent_id: The parent comment of the new comment. Can be null or omitted for a comment that should be directly under the thread
raw_body: The comment’s raw body text
anonymous (optional): A boolean indicating whether the comment is
anonymous_to_peers (optional): A boolean indicating whether the

block_quote.paragraph: comment is anonymous to peers; defaults to false

desc_content.paragraph: PATCH Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: raw_body, anonymous and anonymous_to_peers are accepted with the same

block_quote.paragraph: meaning as in a POST request

list_item.paragraph: edit_reason_code (optional, privileged): A string containing a reason

block_quote.paragraph: code for a moderator to edit the comment.
If “application/merge-patch+json” is not the specified content type, a 415 error is returned.

desc_content.paragraph: GET Response Values:

definition_list_item.term: results: The list of comments; each item in the list has the same

definition.paragraph: fields as the POST response below

list_item.paragraph: next: The URL of the next page (or null if first page)
previous: The URL of the previous page (or null if last page)

desc_content.paragraph: POST/PATCH Response Values:

list_item.paragraph: id: The id of the comment
thread_id: The id of the comment’s thread
parent_id: The id of the comment’s parent
author: The username of the comment’s author, or None if the comment is anonymous
author_label: A label indicating whether the author has a special role in the course, either “Staff” for moderators and administrators or “Community TA” for community TAs
created_at: The ISO 8601 timestamp for the creation of the comment

definition_list_item.term: updated_at: The ISO 8601 timestamp for the last modification of

definition.paragraph: the comment, which may not have been an update of the body

list_item.paragraph: raw_body: The comment’s raw body text without any rendering applied

definition_list_item.term: endorsed: Boolean indicating whether the comment has been endorsed

definition.paragraph: (by a privileged user or, for a question thread, the thread author)

list_item.paragraph: endorsed_by: The username of the endorsing user, if available

definition_list_item.term: endorsed_by_label: A label indicating whether the endorsing user

definition.paragraph: has a special role in the course (see author_label)

definition_list_item.term: endorsed_at: The ISO 8601 timestamp for the endorsement, if

list_item.paragraph: abuse_flagged: Boolean indicating whether the requesting user has flagged the comment for abuse

definition_list_item.term: abuse_flagged_any_user: Boolean indicating whether any user has

definition.paragraph: flagged the comment for abuse. Returns null if requesting user is not a moderator.

list_item.paragraph: voted: Boolean indicating whether the requesting user has voted for the comment
vote_count: The number of votes for the comment
children: The list of child comments (with the same format)

definition_list_item.term: editable_fields: The fields that the requesting user is allowed to

list_item.paragraph: anonymous: A boolean indicating whether the comment is anonymous
anonymous_to_peers: A boolean indicating whether the comment is

block_quote.paragraph: No content is returned for a DELETE request

desc_content.paragraph: Implements the POST method for the list endpoint as described in the class docstring.
Implements the DELETE method for the instance endpoint as described in the class docstring
Implements the GET method for the list endpoint as described in the class docstring.
This endpoint implements two distinct usage contexts.

When username is provided, the course_id parameter is required, and thread_id is ignored. The behavior is to retrieve all of the user’s non-anonymous comments from the specified course, outside of the context of a forum thread. In this context, endorsement information is unavailable.

When username is not provided, thread_id is required, and course_id is ignored, since the thread already belongs to a course. In this context, all information relevant to usage in the discussions forum is available.
Handles the case of fetching a thread’s comments.
Handles the case of fetching an user’s comments.
Implements the PATCH method for the instance endpoint as described in the class docstring.
Implements the GET method for comments against response ID
Bases: DeveloperErrorViewMixin, APIView

desc_content.paragraph: Implements the GET method as described in the class docstring.
Bases: DeveloperErrorViewMixin, APIView
Use Cases Retrieve all the members of a given forum discussion role or update the membership of a role.
GET List Members of a Role Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: course_id (required): The course to which the role belongs to.

rolename (required): The name of the forum discussion role, the members of which have to be listed. Currently supported values are ‘Moderator’, ‘Group Moderator’, ‘Community TA’. If the value has a space it has to be URL encoded.

desc_content.paragraph: POST Update the membership of a Role Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: course_id (required): The course to which the role belongs to.

rolename (required): The name of the forum discussion role, the members of which have to be listed. Currently supported values are ‘Moderator’, ‘Group Moderator’, ‘Community TA’. If the value has a space it has to be URL encoded.

block_quote.paragraph: The body can use either ‘application/x-www-form-urlencoded’ or ‘application/json’ content type.

list_item.paragraph: user_id (required): The username or email address of the user whose membership has to be updated.
action (required): Either ‘allow’ or ‘revoke’, depending on the action to be performed on the membership.

desc_content.paragraph: GET and POST Response Values:

block_quote.paragraph: A HTTP 404 Not Found response status code is returned when the requested course is invalid.
A HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code is returned when the request is invalid.
A HTTP 200 OK response status denote is returned to denote success.

list_item.paragraph: course_id: The course to which the role belongs to.
results: A list of the members belonging to the specified role.
username: Username of the user.
email: Email address of the user.
first_name: First name of the user.
last_name: Last name of the user.
group_name: Name of the group the user belongs to.
division_scheme: The division scheme used by the course.

desc_content.paragraph: Implement a handler for the GET method.
Implement a handler for the POST method.
Bases: DeveloperErrorViewMixin, APIView
Use Cases Retrieve all the discussion settings for a course or update one or more of them.
GET Discussion Settings Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: course_id (required): The course to retrieve the discussion settings for.

desc_content.paragraph: PATCH Discussion Settings Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: course_id (required): The course to retrieve the discussion settings for.

block_quote.paragraph: The body should have the ‘application/merge-patch+json’ content type.

list_item.paragraph: divided_inline_discussions: A list of IDs of the topics to be marked as divided inline discussions.
divided_course_wide_discussions: A list of IDs of the topics to be marked as divided course-wide discussions.
always_divide_inline_discussions: A boolean indicating whether inline discussions should always be divided or not.
division_scheme: A string corresponding to the division scheme to be used from the list of available division schemes.

desc_content.paragraph: GET and PATCH Discussion Settings Parameters Response Values:

block_quote.paragraph: A HTTP 404 Not Found response status code is returned when the requested course is invalid.
A HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code is returned when the request is invalid.
A HTTP 200 OK response status denote is returned to denote success.

list_item.paragraph: id: The discussion settings id.
divided_inline_discussions: A list of divided inline discussions.
divided_course_wide_discussions: A list of divided course-wide discussions.
division_scheme: The division scheme used for the course discussions.
available_division_schemes: A list of available division schemes for the course.

desc_content.paragraph: Implement a handler for the GET method.
Implement a handler for the PATCH method.
Bases: DeveloperErrorViewMixin, APIView

block_quote.paragraph: Retrieve the topic listing for a course. Only topics accessible to the authenticated user are included.

desc_content.paragraph: Example Requests:

definition_list_item.term: GET /api/discussion/v1/course_topics/course-v1:ExampleX+Subject101+2015
Response Values:
courseware_topics: The list of topic trees for courseware-linked

definition.paragraph: topics. Each item in the list includes:

list_item.paragraph: id: The id of the discussion topic (null for a topic that only has children but cannot contain threads itself).
name: The display name of the topic.
children: A list of child subtrees of the same format.

definition_list_item.term: non_courseware_topics: The list of topic trees that are not linked to

definition.paragraph: courseware. Items are of the same format as in courseware_topics.

desc_content.paragraph: Implements the GET method as described in the class docstring.
Bases: DeveloperErrorViewMixin, APIView

Example Requests:
GET Thread List Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: username: (Required) Username of the user whose active threads are required
page: The (1-indexed) page to retrieve (default is 1)
page_size: The number of items per page (default is 10)
count_flagged: If True, return the count of flagged comments for each thread.

block_quote.paragraph: (can only be used by moderators or above)

list_item.paragraph: thread_type: The type of thread to filter None, “discussion” or “question”.
order_by: Sort order for threads “last_activity_at”, “comment_count” or
status: Filter for threads “flagged”, “unanswered”, “unread”.
group_id: Filter threads w.r.t cohorts (Cohort ID).

desc_content.paragraph: Implements the GET method as described in the class docstring.

API will recieve a list of current usernames and their new username.

block_quote.paragraph: Retrieve the list of threads for a course, retrieve thread details, post a new thread, or modify or delete an existing thread.

desc_content.paragraph: Example Requests:
GET Thread List Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: course_id (required): The course to retrieve threads for
page: The (1-indexed) page to retrieve (default is 1)
page_size: The number of items per page (default is 10, max is 100)

definition_list_item.term: topic_id: The id of the topic to retrieve the threads. There can be

definition.paragraph: multiple topic_id queries to retrieve threads from multiple topics at once.

definition_list_item.term: author: The username of an author. If provided, only threads by this
thread_type: Can be ‘discussion’ or ‘question’, only return threads of

list_item.paragraph: flagged: If True, only return threads that have been flagged (reported)
count_flagged: If True, return the count of flagged comments for each thread. (can only be used by moderators or above)

definition_list_item.term: text_search: A search string to match. Any thread whose content

definition.paragraph: (including the bodies of comments in the thread) matches the search string will be returned.

definition_list_item.term: order_by: Must be “last_activity_at”, “comment_count”, or

definition.paragraph: “vote_count”. The key to sort the threads by. The default is “last_activity_at”.

definition_list_item.term: order_direction: Must be “desc”. The direction in which to sort the

definition.paragraph: threads by. The default and only value is “desc”. This will be removed in a future major version.

definition_list_item.term: following: If true, retrieve only threads the requesting user is
view: “unread” for threads the requesting user has not read, or

definition.paragraph: “unanswered” for question threads with no marked answer. Only one can be selected, or unresponded for discussion type posts with no response

list_item.paragraph: requested_fields: (list) Indicates which additional fields to return for each thread. (supports ‘profile_image’)

block_quote.paragraph: The topic_id, text_search, and following parameters are mutually exclusive (i.e. only one may be specified in a request)

desc_content.paragraph: GET Thread Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: thread_id (required): The id of the thread
requested_fields (optional parameter): (list) Indicates which additional

block_quote.paragraph: fields to return for each thread. (supports ‘profile_image’)

desc_content.paragraph: POST Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: course_id (required): The course to create the thread in
topic_id (required): The topic to create the thread in
type (required): The thread’s type (either “question” or “discussion”)
title (required): The thread’s title
raw_body (required): The thread’s raw body text

definition_list_item.term: following (optional): A boolean indicating whether the user should

definition.paragraph: follow the thread upon its creation; defaults to false

list_item.paragraph: anonymous (optional): A boolean indicating whether the post is
anonymous_to_peers (optional): A boolean indicating whether the post

block_quote.paragraph: is anonymous to peers; defaults to false

desc_content.paragraph: PATCH Parameters:

list_item.paragraph: abuse_flagged (optional): A boolean to mark thread as abusive
voted (optional): A boolean to vote for thread
read (optional): A boolean to mark thread as read
closed (optional, privileged): A boolean to mark thread as closed.
edit_reason_code (optional, privileged): A string containing a reason

block_quote.paragraph: code for editing the thread’s body.

list_item.paragraph: close_reason_code (optional, privileged): A string containing a reason
topic_id, type, title, raw_body, anonymous, and anonymous_to_peers

block_quote.paragraph: are accepted with the same meaning as in a POST request
If “application/merge-patch+json” is not the specified content type, a 415 error is returned.

desc_content.paragraph: GET Thread List Response Values:

definition_list_item.term: results: The list of threads; each item in the list has the same

definition.paragraph: fields as the POST/PATCH response below

list_item.paragraph: next: The URL of the next page (or null if first page)
previous: The URL of the previous page (or null if last page)

definition_list_item.term: text_search_rewrite: The search string to which the text_search

definition.paragraph: parameter was rewritten in order to match threads (e.g. for spelling correction)

desc_content.paragraph: GET Thread Details Response Values:

block_quote.paragraph: Same response fields as the POST/PATCH response below

desc_content.paragraph: POST/PATCH response values:

list_item.paragraph: id: The id of the thread
course_id: The id of the thread’s course
topic_id: The id of the thread’s topic
created_at: The ISO 8601 timestamp for the creation of the thread

definition_list_item.term: updated_at: The ISO 8601 timestamp for the last modification of

definition.paragraph: the thread, which may not have been an update of the title/body

list_item.paragraph: type: The thread’s type (either “question” or “discussion”)
title: The thread’s title
raw_body: The thread’s raw body text without any rendering applied
pinned: Boolean indicating whether the thread has been pinned
closed: Boolean indicating whether the thread has been closed
comment_count: The number of comments within the thread

definition_list_item.term: unread_comment_count: The number of comments within the thread

definition.paragraph: that were created or updated since the last time the user read the thread

definition_list_item.term: editable_fields: The fields that the requesting user is allowed to

list_item.paragraph: read: Boolean indicating whether the user has read this thread
has_endorsed: Boolean indicating whether this thread has been answered
response_count: The number of direct responses for a thread

definition_list_item.term: abuse_flagged_count: The number of flags(reports) on and within the

definition.paragraph: thread. Returns null if requesting user is not a moderator

list_item.paragraph: anonymous: A boolean indicating whether the post is anonymous
anonymous_to_peers: A boolean indicating whether the post is

desc_content.paragraph: **DELETE response values:

block_quote.paragraph: No content is returned for a DELETE request

block_quote.paragraph: Upload a file to be attached to a thread or comment.

definition_list_item.term: course_id:

definition.paragraph: The ID of the course where this thread or comment belongs.

definition_list_item.term: thread_key:

definition.paragraph: If the upload belongs to a comment, refer to the parent thread_id, otherwise it should be “root”.

definition_list_item.term: Example Requests:

list_item.paragraph: location: The URL to access the uploaded file.

desc_content.paragraph: Handles a file upload.
